Description: Rectangular limestone stela of Porieuthes; six lines of incised Greek text within the pediment; cross-within-wreath and two pillars below. Pilasters of the relief twisted, with foliated capitals: between them a cross within a wreath.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.135, Pl.96)
Tudor 2011 / Christian Funerary Stelae of the Byzantine and Arab Periods from Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: I.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 96:3 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
